intro: Jungia brachyphylla, commonly known as the short-leaved Jungia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, waxy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
